text: Ülemiste railway station () is a railway station in the Ülemiste sub-district of Tallinn, the capital city of Estonia. It is about 500 metres from Tallinn Airport,Rail.cc. Ülemiste train station / Tallinn. to which it has been connected by a tramline since 2017.ERR News. Tallinn airport tram line to enter into service at end of August. The station is served by the trains of the Estonian government-owned passenger train operator, Elron. Express trains from Tallinn Baltic Station stop at Ülemiste on the way to Tartu and Narva, and there is a commuter service to stations on the line to Aegviidu. ==Rail Baltica== Ülemiste station will be Rail Baltica's Tallinn terminus, which is planned to open in 2030. High-speed trains on Rail Baltica will connect the three Baltic capitals to Poland using the new standard-gauge railway.Rail Baltica. Rail Baltica Unveils Winning Designs for Ülemiste Terminal in Tallinn, Estonia.ERR News. Laying down Rail Baltic in Estonia could start within two years, says CEO. An international competition was held to find a design for the new terminal with "Light Stream" by Zaha Hadid Architects being declared as the winner. The new station will be directly linked to Tallinn Airport by a pedestrian bridge.ERR News. Zaha Hadid Architects win design competition for Ülemiste terminal.Lonely Planey. A futuristic station will make Eastern Europe more accessible than ever ==Related pages== * Rail transport in Estonia ==References== Category:1900 establishments in Europe Category:20th-century establishments in Estonia Category:Rail transport in Estonia Category:Tallinn Category:Railway stations in Europe
title: Ülemiste railway station
